intro: Viborquia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny vibora, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruits are follicles that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Viborquia spinosa is often found in humid forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
